Articles.Content:
Im bored so I had an idea: why not get the KSP comunity to create a kerbal language (sorry it this is in the wrong forum, this one made the most sence to me. Also sorry about spelling mistakes)

Rules

I-dotn replace words people have already made

II-Words with more than 1 sylable must have a pronounciation tihngy EX: kour (kow-er)

Have fun, I'm going to do the numbers up to 25:D

1=zen

2=zit

3=kee

4=kour (kow-er)

5=koo

6=keevin (Key-vin)

7=quet

8=zix

9=gop

10=ta

11=sepevin (see-pev-in)

12=poon

13=keegoo (kee-goo)

14=kourgoo (kow-er-goo)

15=koogoo (koo-goo)

16=keevingoo (key-vin-goo)

17=quetgoo (kwet-goo)

18=zixgoo (ziks-goo)

19=gopgoo (gop-goo)

20=zety (zee-tee)

21=zety-zen (zee-tee-zen)

22=zety-zit (zee-tee-zit)

23=zety-kee (zee-tee-kee)

24=zety-kour (zee-tee-kow-er)

25=zety-koo (zee-tee-koo)

I cant wait to see what you guys come up with:)
kerbals already have a language... backwards spanish

Kerbals do speak and their language is backwards spanish. Thus

1=onu

2=sod

3=sert

4=ortauc

5=ocnic

6=sies

7=eteis

8=ohco

9=eveun

10=zeid

etc

Same goes for all their words and "pronounciation tihngy"

Watch the release videos, they speak backwards spanish (wich unfortunately sounds very different from written backwards spanish). The only way you can make a dictionary is getting a friend who speaks spanish (wish I had a good microphone), recording the words you want, reverting the audio, and then writing down those sounds.
